module.p: ma if is a subordinating conjunction.

Examples from Gairm –
Ma rannsaicheas sinn air ais fada gu leòir chì sinn nach robh sgoilean anns an Oban gus an ochdamh linn deug. Bha an sgoil bheag a b’ fhaisge air anns a’ Chill Mhóir cóig mìle air falbh, agus tha e coltach gu robh an sgoil sin air an fheadhainn bu shine an Earra-Ghaidheal.
If we research back long enough we will see that there were no schools in Oban until the eighteenth century. The closest little school was in Kilmore five miles away, and it appears that that school was one of the oldest in Argyll. td. 363
Ma bha Hegel a’ déiligeadh ris an t-saoghal ar an taobh a-muigh, ’sann a bha Kierkegaard a’ déiligeadh gu tric ris an fheallsanach fhéin.
If Hegel dealt with the outside world, it was the philosopher himself that K. usually dealt with. td. 103
[...] ’Se glé bheag de chobhair a thug a’ Phàrlamaid a riamh do ’n Ghàidhlig no do fhoghlum agus do litreachas na Gàidhlig. Cuin a chualas ball-Pàrlarnaid a’ togail a ghuth a dh’ iarraidh leasachaidh do staid Gàidhlig ann an Albainn? Am bi cothrom a nis aig cuideigin a ghuth a thogail, anns an t-suidheachadh iongantach a th’ againn anns a’ Phàrlamaid ùr? Chan eil sinn ag iarraidh air an duine so, ma tha e ann, a’ Ghàidhlig a chur air thoiseach air lòn is obair is caitheamh-beatha an t-sluaigh. Chan eil sinn ag iarraidh ach beagan ceartais.
[...] The Parliament has given very little assistance ever to the Gaelic language or to Gaelic education and literature. When has a member of Parliament been heard raising his voice to demand improvement for the state of Gaelic in Scotland? Will someone have an opportunity now to raise his voice, in the unexpected situation we have in the new Parliament? We are not asking of this person, if he exists, to prioritise Gaelic over food and jobs and the populations standard of living. We only want a modicum of justice. td. 9, ‘Air an Spiris’

Biblical examples –
[...] Agus labhair righ na h-Eiphit re mnaibh-glùine nan Eabhruidheach [...] Agus thubhairt e, ’Nuair a ni sibh gnìomh mnà-glùine do na mnaibh Eabhruidheach, agus a chi sibh iad air na stòlaibh; ma’s mac a bhios ann, ’an sin marbhaidh sibh e, ach ma’s nighean a bhios ann, bithidh si beo. [...]
[...] And the king of Egypt spake to the Hebrew midwives [...] And he said, When ye do the office of a midwife to the Hebrew women, and see them upon the stools; if it be a son, then ye shall kill him: but if it be a daughter, then she shall live. [...] Ecsodus I.8–16
